column4: I just installed Ubuntu on my macbook air along with OS X Mountain Lion following this guide (https://help.ubuntu.com/community/MactelSupportTeam/AppleIntelInstallation). Install went fine, I booted into OS X fine after partition sync via refit as in directions; went to boot into Ubuntu and get this friendly error - "Missing Operating System". What in the world now?
your ubuntu is likely still present, but the bootloader scrambled.  reinstall refit.
How would I install grub from the live cd without reinstalling Ubuntu?
did it EVER work?  and what method did you use to install the driver?
It did till 2 days ago. The driver came installed out of the box w/ ubuntu.
Now it tries to connect for a long time, says its connected but then doesn't load pages
try soliloquy1 NO pages anywhere or just some pages?
if no response, suspect dns settings.  Sorry, but while I know how to install the broadcom drivers, I know nothing of DNS.
the broadcom STA driver's enabled, unknown host for google, 8.8.8.8 got destination unreachable
then you're not connected.  Try rebooting and also reinitialize the router if connected.
I've done both over and over and over. it says I'm connected, but I'm clearly not. It can see the wifi network, though.
DNS > over my head.  Stay in channel and ask patiently.
oh, that's nice.  Blame the father!  :)
but yeah, ask Dad about it.  Good luck.
